ai.summary: Capel walk (SCC) is a challenging 19.3 km hike in the UK, aimed at experienced walkers. The route features varied terrain and notable elevation changes, delivering a rewarding endurance challenge and rural scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Long grass paths, farm tracks, and mixed surface trails with potential mud. Expect uneven footing, gentle to substantial ascents, and occasional open-country sections with exposure.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers; bring a waterproof jacket. Carry a detailed map (or GPS) and a compass; don’t rely on phone alone. Bring sufficient water and energy snacks; a small first aid kit and emergency whistle are recommended. Inform someone of your route and finish time; carry a fully charged phone and a portable charger. Stay on marked paths and take care on slippery surfaces after rain.
recommended_gear: Layers of clothing and a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with fully charged battery and portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March to October); summer conditions are often best, but be prepared for heat and sun.

seo.title: Capel Walk (SCC) – 19.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Capel Walk (SCC), a 19.3 km hard hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and essential gear to tackle this challenging route.
